{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1565].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In some cases, users do not estimate progress in JIRA in hours or story points, but in issue transitions. This makes it difficult to use Portfolio to track the progress of plans, since they are measured in hours, days and Story Points. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Add the ability to measure progress by issue transitions and further to map statuses to Portfoliio stages.
fields.summary: Allow progress to be based on issue transition
Add Ability To Filter Scope By Stages To Live Plans
Updates to fixversion on issues does not update to Portfolio
Define hours per plan for shared team members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1748].
  {panel}

h3. Problem description
Given there is a Live Plan importing issue from a number of different projects and some of these projects need to have strict permission restrictions.
If a user does not have the "Schedule Issue" permission on one of these projects he will be able to "scenario"-rank issues of these projects in the Live Plan, but he won't be able to commit these changes - keeping them forever in the Uncommitted changes list.

h3. Suggestion(s)
One solution would be to provide an option to decouple ranking between JIRA and the Live Plan for one or more issue sources. If issues from these issue sources are ranked these are excluded from committing.
Another would be to introduce a more sophisticated permission scheme for ranking in Portfolio.
A thisd option would be to provide the possibility to ignore certain changes on the commit list (forever).
fields.summary: As a user I want to decouple ranking between Live Plans and JIRA for certain issue sources

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1316].
  {panel}

The Business Value of an Initiative or Epic is the most important parameter for prioritization.
However JIRA Portfolio does not have a field or column to indicate the Business Value.

Oddly enough the CSV export includes a field or column "BusinessValue", just next to "Estimate_Total" and "Estimate_Original" ...

Please make the Business Value field or column visible and editable in JIRA Portfolio.
fields.summary: Business Value field editable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1578].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the Portfolio Scope view, you are able to create epics. However, you are not able to easily associate existing Stories to the created epic. The user has to either go to the issue in JIRA to achieve this or go to the Agile board, where you currently have drag and drop functionality to associate stories to epics. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the way for users to easily associate stories to epics in the scope view itself. Perhaps a drag and drop mechanism like in JIRA Agile backlog.
fields.summary: As an user, I would like to be able to associate  stories onto Epic to associate them in the Scope view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the release is present in two different plans and the dates for the release are *dynamic* / *relative to the previous release*, the release dates are calculated based on the current plan resources. 
*  !relative start dates.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have the same dates for the releases in the different plans.
fields.summary: Plan dependancy in Portfolio Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the only possibility to [Re-prioritizing work items|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/re-prioritizing-work-items-828785253.html] is using the drag and drop functionality

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to re-prioritise stories by changing the Priority number in front of the issue
*  !Reprioritize Stories.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Why this is important
The Priority of the Epic depends on its highest priority Story. This means that the users need to change the view to Story and then Reprioritise the work items. If there are many issues it is difficult to use the drag and drop functionality only.  

h3. Workaround 
Re-prioritize (re-rank) the Stories in Backlog in JIRA
fields.summary: Better way to re-prioritise stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1582].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently users who have Edit permission will be able to delete any of the boards available. A new Delete Plan permission is necessary to allow users creating plans freely but restrict the ability to delete plans created by other users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a new delete plan permission that automatically has Creator and Administrator in them. The creator has the option to give the functionality to a user/group.
 
h3. Workaround 
Update the *Access control > Permission* of the recently created Plan to only selected user/group.
fields.summary: Add delete Plan permisison

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1464].
  {panel}

+Value Statement+: As a user, I want better sync from Software to Portfolio for uncommitted changes so I have accurate issue data.

With 2.0, the synchronization has improved tremendously between Software and Portfolio with Live Plans (now the standard plan).  But I am still having conflict problems with changes made to issues in Software and uncommitted changes to those same issues in Portfolio.

For instance (in this example we'll say the original release is _Version 1.0_ for the story):

# First, I'll change the Release for the story in Portfolio to _Version 2.0_. It will show as an Uncommitted change, as it should
# Next, I will go into that same story in Software and change the Release to _Version 2.5_. It updates there, so far so good
# Finally I go back into Portfolio, I have an uncommitted change that is different than my latest update to that same issue in Software.  There is no easy way to tell when looking through uncommitted changes what the effect would be
# If I revert the change in Portfolio, it will show the release as 2.5, the one I made in step 2
# If I commit the change in Portfolio, it will update the issue in Software as well to 2.0, the one I made in step 1

I don't know what the right solution would be.  Any change made in Software overrides any uncommitted changes in Portfolio?  A better view of uncommitted changes to know if there are conflicts between the two?
fields.summary: Better sync between Software and Portfolio for Uncommitted Changes

fields.description:
This is the Jira Cloud version of JPOSERVER-1909
h1. The Issue

Presently I can only change the ticket type of tickets in the Scope Pane at one instance: upon initially planning the ticket. Once the ticket has been planned; but, before changes has been committed you cannot change the ticket type.
h1. Screenshots

You can only change the issue type when first planning a ticket.

!image-2019-01-07-11-29-00-569.png!

Once the ticket has been planned; but, before it has been committed you cannot change the ticket type – even though the ticket has not been created yet (note the lack of the ticket code)

!image-2019-01-07-11-28-10-187.png!
h1. 
User Story

As a Jira Portfolio user, I may select a ticket in the Scope pane that has been planned *but not committed* and may change the issue type (provided I have permission to change issue types). Since the ticket has not been created in Jira yet (changes has not been committed), this should not change the number of committed changes.
fields.summary: Ability to change issue type in portfolio
Add column that maps with Priority from JIRA Software

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Story Points option is disabled while updating the planning unit

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan and set a project (or filter) as its source 
# Open the plan settings and you'll see the option Story Points is disabled under planning unit section
# On the plan settings remove the source and add a scrum board
# Open the plan settings and you'll see the option Story Points is disabled under planning unit section

h3. Expected Results
Story Points option is disabled when the source of the plan is not a scrum board however it should be available if you change the source.

h3. Actual Results
Story points is not available even if the source of the plan is a scrum board
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3. Workaround
Create a new plan and set the board as the source
fields.summary: Story Points planning unit is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1568].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a board with 2 sprints and 1 story
 # Move the story into the first sprint. Start the sprint.
 # Close the sprint. The story should now be in the backlog
 # Create a Portfolio plan based on the board
 # Assign the issue to the board team. Commit.
 # Assign the issue to the second sprint.
 # We see "1 Uncommitted change" at the top. Click the button

Expected:
 - We see the issue's sprint assignment in the commit dialog

Actual:
 - No changes are shown

h2. Workaround

There are 2 workarounds:

1. Change the issues team to calculate, then change it back to the proper team. Then assign the sprint. Then commit the issue.
 2. Assign the issue to a sprint manually inside JIRA. The commit dialog should then show the uncommitted change of the issue's sprint.
fields.summary: Sprint assignments don't show up in the commit dialog for issues that are assigned to closed sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting up a sprint to end on June 25th in the board, the plan in Advance Roadmaps will show this sprint as ending on June 24th

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sprint in a board. Set its end date and time
 # Create a plan in Advanced Roadmaps to include that sprint

h3. Expected Results
The sprint's end date will be taken from the sprint data

h3. Actual Results

Due to some algorithms in the back-end, the sprint's end date in the plan is shown as one day sooner (plan's sprint end-date = board's sprint end date -1 ).
This happens even if the plan's time zone matches the user's time zone.

h3. Additional Notes
Similar issue with the sprint start date as well.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In the plan view, sprint's end date is one day sooner than the actual date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-971].
  {panel}

GIVEN i am within the Portfolio Add On
AND the Epics and Stories already have a Issue Link and therefore exist in Jira Agile
WHEN i move a Story in Portfolio to another Epic
THEN the Epic Link of that Story within Jira Agile should be updated to the new Epic
ACTUALLY the Epic Link Stays the same in Jira Agile and does not represent the new relationship as set in Portfolio Add On

GIVEN i am within JIRA Agile 
AND i Update the Epic Link of the Story to another Epic which is already known and existing within the Portfolio Backlog
WHEN i update from Date
AND i go to the Portfolio Backlog in order to see if the update was successfull
THEN the new Relationship between Epic and Child Story should be represented and not differ from the relationship within Jira Agile
ACTUALLY it is not updated
fields.summary: Move to Epic (story) does not Update Epic Link in Jira Agile for Story and vice versa

h3. Summary
Plan "Start Date" depends on the release that has Fixed Start date in one of the projects, even if there are more projects used as Issue Source

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have Single releases in each project and set one release with a *Fixed Start Date* and the other releases should be with start date *As early as possible*

h3. Expected Results
The plan "Start Date" is as early as possible

h3. Actual Results
The plan "Start Date" equal to the release Fixed Start date
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Plan "Start Date" depends on the release that has Fixed Start date in one of the projects, even if there are more projects used as Issue Source

fields.summary: Live Plan commit crash when removing time value on issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1874].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When attempting to commit changes to a Portfolio Plan the user is presented with a infinate loading screen when commiting changes to a plan that they have added, if the user does not have permissions to create an issue for any item in the commit list
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Portfolio
 ** Tested on:
 *** 2.2.2
 *** 2.0.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove a users ability to create issues permission for a project on the plan
 # Login as user
 # have user add issue to plan
 # Commit Changes

h3. Expected Results
User is presented with a permission error noting they do not have permission to create the issue in the project

h3. Actual Results
User is presented with the page load Spinner and must press escape to exit with no indication of error onscreen:
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-22 at 11.28.41 AM.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code:java}
2017-03-22 11:26:50,574 http-nio-63402-exec-17 WARN test 686x899x1 1f7gahs 172.20.44.21 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.j.env.issues.JiraIssueService] Could not create issue. Validation-errors: {pid=You do not have permission to create issues in this project.}
2017-03-22 11:26:50,574 http-nio-63402-exec-17 WARN test 686x899x1 1f7gahs 172.20.44.21 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.j.scenario.common.BaseScenarioEntityCommitService] Error in commit operation.
2017-03-22 11:26:50,574 http-nio-63402-exec-17 WARN test 686x899x1 1f7gahs 172.20.44.21 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.j.scenario.issue.IssueScenarioEntityCommitExceptionHandler] Exception when trying to commit issue: Specific error details: {pid=You do not have permission to create issues in this project.}.
{code}
The below Exception is displayed in the Javascript Console:
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 ()
batch.js:44398 ajax[41210662] error : {
successful  : false,
status      : 400,
statusText  : error,
hasData     : true,
readyState  : 4,
requestId   : 41210662,
aborted     : undefined,
}
{code}
!Screen Shot 2017-03-22 at 11.45.49 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Changes can be committed by a user with create issue permission or grant create issue permission to the user
fields.summary: 400 Error on Commit Changes when user does not have create permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user has permissions in the plan permission configuration but they don't have permission in the Advanced Roadmaps global permission section when the user tries to add new issue sources to the plan, the page only reloads and they cannot complete the issue source configuration
h3. Environment

Portfolio for Jira cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Portfolio plan
 # Access *Plans > Settings > Advanced Roadmaps permissions* and grant all the permissions only for a specific group ("administrators" for example)
 # Access the Advanced Roadmaps plan and click *more(...) > Configure > Permissions* and add a user who isn't a member of the group used in the previous step to the *Editors* plan access level
 # Login to Jira using the user set as "editor" in the previous step and access the Advanced Roadmaps plan using the plan's URL (the plan name will not be visible in the UI for this user)
 # Access the Advanced Roadmaps plan and click *more(...) > Configure > Issue sources* and click *Edit sources*
 # Select any new option as an issue source and click *Next*

h3. Expected Results

The "Select relevant releases" screen and others are visible and the user can add new issue sources
h3. Actual Results

The page reloads and returns to the add issue view screen

!Screen Recording 2019-08-19 at 03.51 PM.gif|width=735,height=575!

Logs
{code:java}
{
  "micros_container": "reverse_proxy",

  "http_user_agent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_3) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/76.0.3809.100 Safari/537.36",
  "logType": "access",
  "product": "nginx",
  "request_method": "POST",
  "request_size": "3418",
  "request_time": "0.036",
  "status": "401",
  "uri_path": "/rest/jpo/1.0/plan/setup/projects",
  "response_duration": "0.036",
  "normalised_uri": "",
  "graphql_operation": "",
  "env": "prod-east",
  "": "",
  "time": "2019-08-16T18:08:15Z"
}{code}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Add the affected users to the group which is listed in Portfolio global permissions or add a group the user is a member of to the Portfolio global permissions
fields.summary: Users cannot add new issue sources if they have permissions only at the plan level

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Portfolio Viewer attempts to access 'View Plans' so they can see the plans they would like to view, they are redirected to the login screen, and a 401 error is thrown in the browser console.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a group to the Portfolio Viewer Permission and verify that this group is not a Portfolio User
# Add a user to that group, but make sure they are not a part of the Portfolio user group(s)
# Login as that user and navigate to the 'View all Plans' button in the Portfolio dropdown
# User will be redirected to login. In browser console you can see 401 error.

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to see the list of plans they have read-only access to.

h3. Actual Results
User is redirected to login page and cannot see list of plans they should be able to view in read-only mode.
 
h3. Notes
Add group to the Portfolio User permission and add 'Edit' restrictions on each plan to ensure that this particular group can only view all plans.

Also, this appears to be similar (if not exact) to JPO-1478. I have linked it to this ticket.
fields.summary: Portfolio Viewers redirected to login when attempting to see Plans

h3. Workaround

Based on our investigations so far, this bug occurs when calculating the schedule (work assignments) for Agile sprints if the capacity of at least one of the people working on this sprint is exceeded.
In order to get the plan working again please adapt the scope of all imported Agile sprints manually by either removing issues from the sprint or adapting their estimates.

We are working on this and hope to provide fix soon.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1532].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Scheduling algorithm considers Rank first than any other values such as dependencies. When there are multiple backlogs and teams working on the same Plan, it may get an unexpected result.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Have Backlog A and Backlog B runs in parallel on two different backlogs with assigned to two different teams.

Backlog A has the following backlog (rank in brackets):
 BACKLOGA-1 (1)
 BACKLOGA-2 (2)
 BACKLOGA-3 (3)
 BACKLOGA-4 (4)
 BACKLOGA-5 (5)

Backlog B has the following backlog (rank in brackets)
 BACKLOGB-1 (6)
 BACKLOGB-2 (7)
 BACKLOGB-3 (8)
 BACKLOGB-4 (9)
 BACKLOGB-5 (10)

If BACKLOGA-1 has a dependency on BACKLOGB-2 it does not schedule it straight after BACKLOGB-2 completes (which it should, because it is first in the backlog and has the highest rank).
h3. Expected Results

BACKLOGA-1 scheduled right after BACKLOGB-2
h3. Actual Results

BACKLOGA-1 scheduled after BACKLOGA-5
h3. Notes

This is because, in scheduling, Rank is considered first then other values such as dependency. It is an expected behaviour, JPO-1531 open to adding this in the documentation.
fields.summary: Schedule Dependency equal to Rank on Multiple backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issues that have a calculated assignment to a particular version or team do not match a filter for that version or team if there is a pending scenario change on the issue that sets version or team to _Calculate_.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project with 2 versions (version 1 and version 2)
 # Create some issues in the project and a new Portfolio Plan (include those 2 versions)
 # Estimate some issues with Story Points so that Portfolio will attempt to assign the release
 # For an issue that is automatically assigned by Portfolio with _version 1_ (ie ABC-1), change it to _version 2_ and change it back to *Calculate*
 # Click on {{Calculate}} button and notice that it's assigned back to _version 1_
 # On _Releases filter_, select _version 1_ to filter out issues

h3. Actual Result

ABC-1 is excluded from _version 1_ release filter
h3. Expected Result

ABC-1 is included as part of _version 1_ release filter.
fields.summary: Filtering for versions/teams does not work when there is a pending scenario change to "Calculate" for versions/teams on an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-755].
  {panel}

Hi!
We have issues in Sprint1 in Portfolio http://prntscr.com/8thcvy

Part of them is only partly done http://prntscr.com/8thd7v

When Sprint1 will be finished, all issues that were not completed will be moved to Sprint2 (and some issues from Sprint2 will be pushed out by them to Sprint3 and so on) http://prntscr.com/8thegt

The question is: if the issue have 10 hours estimation and completed 90% in Sprint1 (9 hours is tracked as done) after moving to the next Spint2 (in our case) how much time will it "book" for a given team member (10 hours or 1 hour)?

Could you please help me to understand. Thank you!

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1259].
  {panel}

*Problem*
I open my Portfolio Live Plan and create a new story under an epic. I commit these changes, and the issue is created in JIRA.
When I look at this issue in JIRA there is no connection to the epic under which it was created.

*Expected behaviour*
When creating stories under an Epic in the Live View planner, that epic should be set as the epic link on the newly created issue after commiting.
fields.summary: Tasks created in Live plan under a Epic is not connected to that Epic in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is known that Portfolio for Jira doesn't support dependency for sub-tasks. However, the error thrown is causing confusion within the plan to detect the offending dependencies. With the error cyclic dependency is thrown, users will start to look for a cyclic dependency without knowing that a dependency set for sub-task is the cause.

h3. Suggested fix

 A specific error relevant to the cause should be thrown.
fields.summary: Dependencies for sub-task throws misleading cyclic dependency error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1248].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
When a user creates and links backlog items from Portfolio to JIRA, the _Create Issue_ dialog of JIRA pops up when there are required fields that have defined default values.

*Expected behaviour:*
The dialog should not pop up in this scenario since all required fields can be pre-populated with the default values and hence there is no need to show the dialog
fields.summary: When creating and linking backlog items to JIRA, the create issue dialog pops up even though mandatory fields have defined default values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1813].
  {panel}

h2. Problem
In a plan that uses default estimates, an issue receives an "Item ignored - The estimates on this item are too small." violation which prevents the issue from being scheduled. However, entering a value of 0 will keep the issue from being scheduled anyway, so the only notable effect of this is the violation showing up on the issue in the scope table. The violation should not be there, but does not make a difference from a scheduling point-of-view.

h2. Work-around
Remove the explicit estimate of 0 on the issue (which will cause the issue to be unestimated, unless it receives an estimate via estimate conversion set up for its issue source. In that case, the secondary estimate should be removed from the issue, if possible).
fields.summary: Issues that are set to an estimate of 0 show "Item ignored" warning when default estimates are used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1758].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
Changing Issue source doesnt work


h3. Steps to reproduce:

Create Portfolio plan using a Board as a source. 
Select an issue at the plan > Click *Exclude from plan*. 
Plan name  > *Configure* > *Issue Source*
Remove the board from issue source
Re-add the same board > make sure the excluded issue is selected again > *Next*

h3. Expected: 
The issues is added back to the plan

h3. Actual
The issues is not showing in the plan

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Changing Issue source doesnt work
Progress against Epic disappears when sprint is closed

h3. Workaround

Set all the teams' iteration lengths to a valid value (iteration length > 0)

To do that go to the "Teams" view and click on the "Scrum" drop down.

Hit Recalculate.
fields.summary: Illegal interval exception when calculating a Portfolio schedule

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Parent issue is not listed on timeline when line is set to global

h3. Environment
* Jira Software + Portfolio

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 _scrum_ projects
# On _scrum_ 1
#* Create a *story* and an *epic* 
#* Add the *story* to the *epic*
#* Create a _sprint_ and add the *story*
#* Start the _sprint_
# On _scrum_ 2
#* Create a *story*
#* Create a _sprint_ and add the *story*
#* Start the _sprint_
# Create a plan and add both boards
# Estimate the 2 *stories*
# Add the *story* from _scrum_ 2 to the *epic* of _scrum_ 1 
# On the _team_ section of the plan:
#* Associate each team to a sprint
# Calculate the plan
# Change the plan scope to *epic*
# On the cog icon, set line to *Global*
#* The *epic* won't be listed on timeline
#** If you change the line to *Projects* then it's going to be displayed

h3. Expected Results
Issue should always be listed on timeline if it's scheduled.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is not displayed when it's children issues are from different projects, with different sprints, and teams are assigned to specific sprints.
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3. Workaround
*
fields.summary: Parent issue is not listed on timeline when line is set to global

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1533].
{panel}
*Problem*
 In case there are certain fields required for specific issue types and this requirement condition is modelled with a [workflow validator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-validators], Advanced Roadmaps won't bring up the _Create issue_ dialog when trying to commit an issue of this type to JIRA and hence the issue creation will fail.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Navigate to the workflow configuration page and select one to edit. 

View the workflow digram and select the *Create Issue* transition. 

Select the validators link and add a *Field Required Validator*

**Publish the changes to the workflow

Returning to the plan, create an issue applicable to this workflow

Click on Review Changes, and then Save Selected Changes

*Result*

The workflow validation will be applied and the "Changes cannot be saved" notification is displayed to the user. 

On the new improved interface:
{code}
Could not be committed for unknown reasons.
Item could not be committed for unknown reasons. Please contact your administrator.
{code}

*Workaround*
 Configure the required field via [field configurations and screens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Project+screens%2C+schemes+and+fields] and [specify the field behaviour|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Specifying+field+behavior#Specifyingfieldbehavior-changingfieldsModifyingfieldbehavior] this way.

*Notes*
 The workaround doesn't apply to system fields that are locked by default (ie. Parent Link, Team)

We are working on better supporting required fields via workflows.
fields.summary: Cannot create issues when required fields are configured in workflow validator rather than field configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1388].
  {panel}

Every time any team member attempts to import new boards, projects, epics, releases, etc into an existing LABS plan by editing the issue sources, we receive an error message and are unable to import the data.  

Repro Steps:
# Open up an existing JIRA Portfolio LABS plan
# Click on the Ellipsis and select Configure
# Click on Issue Sources
# Click on Edit Sources
# Go through the steps and edit releases and/or epics.  Adding and/or removing them from the plan.
# Click Done and error message below is received.

fields.summary: Error importing new issue sources into Portfolio LABS

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When the same custom field has been added to multiple Portfolio plans and is removed from just one of them, it disappears from all Portfolio plans it has been added to
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create at least two Portfolio plans
 # Add the exact same custom field to all plans via the _Plan > Configure > Custom fields_ page
 # Remove that custom field from one of the plans

h3. Expected behaviour

The custom field is removed from that one plan but remains added to all other plans
h3. Actual behaviour

The custom field is disconnected from all plans
h3. Workaround

None; we are working on this with highest priority
fields.summary: Removing a custom field from one plan removes that custom field from all plans

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If committing changes, substask type are incorrectly selected if there is any required field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 

# Have a plan and a project
# Have multiple Subtask issue types in this project
# Import the project to the plan
# Make any field required in Field Configuration
# Create Subtask in the plan
# Click Uncommitted Changes
# Commit Selected changes

h3. Actual Result

- Issue Type field is shown as not editable (even if it actually is)
- It used the first Subtask type and it's not using the correct type
--  !image-2017-04-08-11-17-59-323.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

- Portfolio should select the correct Subtask type.
fields.summary: Incorrect Subtask Type selected if there is a required field in Commit changes

fields.description:
There is a scheduling bug which results in issues being scheduled for a wrong person and surfaces under the following circumstances:

* It concerns only sub-tasks having either an assignee in Portfolio or Jira assignees with a Jira assignee level above or equal sub-tasks.
* There must be a certain number of possible member/sub-task assignments (which resource can be assigned to which sub-task).

Workaround:
Try reducing the possible assignments of sub-tasks. That means that if each of sub-tasks has either an assignee in Jira or an assignee in Portfolio, the problem will not appear.
fields.summary: Issues being scheduled for a wrong person in Portfolio Plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you enter an ampersand (&) in the Portfolio Plan name, the left sidebar menu item shows the html entity code rather than interpreting the code. *edit: this is also affecting when using accentuation characters in plan name.

h3. Environment
Portfolio for Jira Cloud - Plan name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan with the character '&' or any accentuation character

h3. Expected Results
The character '&' should appear in the plan name

h3. Actual Results
The code '&' is displayed in the left sidebar where it should be '&'.

h3. Notes
 !portfolio-bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the words 'and' instead of '&' while this bug is not fixed.
fields.summary: When using ampersand (&) or accentuation character in the Plan name the Portfolio sidebar cannot interpret it

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new react UI the *Convert time to story points* function does not work and Issue Estimates are not converted or calculated for unestimated Issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In your Plan, go to *Configure* > *Issue Sources* then *Advanced settings* to a Project
# Set *Convert time to story points* to *ON* and add a value (ie: 1 H = 1 story point)
 !Portfolio_plan_-_Portfolio_for_Jira_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
# Have an Issue in JIRA in the concerned Project with an *Original Estimate* set and no *Story points*
# Calculate Plan

h3. Expected Results

In the Plan, the *Story Points* columns for that Issue gets a value which is calculated and converted from the *Original Estimate*.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and the *Story Points* column remains blank.
 !Portfolio_plan_-_Portfolio_for_Jira_-_JIRAh.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
There is currently no known workaround. Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Story point calculation based on time tracking for unestimated items is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Team Avatars are prohibitively large when exporting the issues utilizing the "Team" field through Issue Navigator

h3. Environment
* Jira Portfolio Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to any filter that includes issues with an assigned "Team" field
# Click on the *Print* button on the top-right
# Click on *Print details*
# Observe the issues with the "Team" field

h3. Expected Results

An export with normal sized "Team" avatars

h3. Actual Results

Oversized Team Avatar fields

 !Team Avatar - Report Example.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Without any actual method to change the Team Avatars in fields, there isn't any way to circumvent this issue
fields.summary: Team Avatars oversized in exported/printed filters through Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Portfolio Releases Report give an error when trying to when trying to check one of the options on its settings
h3. Environment
JIRA Version: 1000.621.5
Agile Version: 1000.226.0
Portfolio Plugin build: 2.1.6-OD-007-D20161214T122104

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Portfolio plan
# Go to Reports
# Select Releases report
# Click the Cog menu on the right to open the Report settings
# Check or uncheck any of the options there

h3. Expected Results
The checked/unchecked option is applied
h3. Actual Results
An error is presented in the browser saying:{quote}Bummer, something has gone terribly wrong here...
Please try refreshing the page. If the issue continues, please copy and paste the information in the Details button below and send to your JIRA Administrator or Atlassian Support.{quote}
Clicking the Show details button it gives more details:{quote}Script error. in 

Line# 0, Col# 0. Detailed stacktrace not available in your browser.{quote}
 
h3. Notes
No stacktrace is presented in the logs.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Error when changing Releases Reports settings

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When the profile language is set to Japanese, the parent link options do not show up when in issue view. 

h2. How to reproduce
# Create an issue with Parent link
# While in issue view, click parent link and the list of parent links show up
# Now go to profile setting 
# Select Japanese language and save
# View the earlier created issue 
# The list of parent links are missing

h3. Expected behavior
The list of parent links should always be available in any language

h3. Actual results
The list of parent links are missing while viewing the issue in Japanese language

h2. Workaround
Switch profile language to English
fields.summary: Parent link options dont show in issue view when language is set to Japanese

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1792].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you setup any announcement banner, accessing the top section of JIRA's navigation menu will no longer be possible.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.6
* JIRA Portfolio 2.1.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an announcement banner in JIRA
# Access JIRA Portfolio

h3. Expected Results
Everything will show as normal in the UI itself

h3. Actual Results
The top section of JIRA's navigation menu is missing and the announcement banner it not showing as well
 
h3.Workaround
* Open a new browser to separately access JIRA Portfolio
* Temporary disable announcement banner configuration
fields.summary: JIRA's navigation menu is missing when there is announcement banner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1317].
  {panel}

This is very confusing to me and I'm really hoping this is poor understanding on my part.

I want to be able to allow a client access to a specific plan. I want them to be able to make changes to the plan but not to apply any updates back to Jira Agile. 

I've set up a user group for a restricted user and added them to it, but how do I actually get this to work? I don't want them to see all plans so I need to add their name to a plan but if I do they either get full editor permissions, or viewer only permissions, neither of which are suitable.

As I understand it right now, the permissions set up would mean I can't allow them 'Rectricted User' access and keep plans between clients confidential, which is a major concern and can not happen under any circumstances.
fields.summary: Permissions at plan level conflict with global permissions
zzzzzzzzzz

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint field value is showing inconsistencies when being committed into JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Manually set a Sprint or let Portfolio calculate a Sprint to an issue in Portfolio.
# Commit the change
 !port.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The changes should be reflected in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will not show the Sprint field for the issue stating that it has no value for the field which indicates that Portfolio commit didn't reached JIRA.
 !iss.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This doesn't seem to be happening for all issues but no pattern was found/
fields.summary: Portfolio is not committing the Sprint value of issues to JIRA

fields.description:
h2. Problem
When opening the Portfolio plan page a bummer message appears, the details are empty and look like
 !bummerDetails.png|thumbnail! 
When opening the dev tools of the browser, in the console we can see the following script error:
{color:red}{{Uncaught syntax error: Unexpected token <}}{color}

This error happens when Portfolio's feedback issue collector that cannot properly be downloaded.

h2. Workaround
Try to hard-refresh the Portfolio plan page (e.g., CMD+R in Chrome in OSX) or clear the browser cache.

We are working on a solution.
fields.summary: Bummer and script error 'Unexpected token <' in browser console when opening Portfolio plan page

fields.description:
Verified on Firefox 62.0.2 (64-bit) and Chrome 69.0.3497.100 (64-bit)
Still working on Safari.


*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Go to a Portfolio plan
2. Click on some issue key from the backlog section in order to open and see the description and scheduling details 
3. Press on the `Escape` button to go back to the backlog overview

*Expected Result:*
The detailed view window is closed and user is seeing the backlog list 

*Actual Result:*
The hotkey is not working anymore, so user has to click on the "close" icon manually, which is very inconvenient while working with the list of issues. 

 !Screen Shot 2018-09-28 at 17.24.30.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-09-28 at 17.24.44.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: On FF and Chrome the "Escape" button is not working anymore in a Portfolio Plan's backlog as a shortcut to close the issue details opened in the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Portfolio new UI isn't showing all issues (open and closed) when the plan has more issues than the Portfolio limit allows (5000 issues)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Portfolio plan with many issue sources. The issues sources must return more than 5000 issues (open and closed). This should include multiple hierarchy levels (Initiatives, Epics, Stories)
# In the Portfolio view, select the filters *Status*  and *Completion date*
# In these filters, select the *Open and completed issues* option and select a date in the past
# Select the Epic hierarchy level

h3. Expected Results

A grey arrow is shown next to the Epics with stories under it and if you click the arrow it says "The next level of the hierarchy is currently disabled. There are too many issues to load them all individually. Please use filters to narrow down the data set first."

h3. Actual Results

The arrow isn't displayed and it seems Portfolio isn't returning the stories under the Epic

h3. Workaround

Contact the Atlassian support to disable the new Portfolio UI
fields.summary: The new Portfolio UI isn't showing all issues when the plan reaches the Portfolio issue limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Scope's issue details view gets cropped when the description has multiple lines or if the screen has a lower resolution

h3. Environment

* Jira Software cloud
* Portfolio for Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Portfolio plan
# Edit one of the visible issues and add a long description, using multiple lines

h3. Expected Results

All the issue's details are displayed

h3. Actual Results

The bottom of the issue details (Scheduling section) gets cropped

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-17 at 3.38.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

* Use the zoom out option of your browser, press and hold the "Ctrl" key, and then press the "\-" (zoom out) for Windows and Linux machines and press and hold the "Command" key, and then press the "-" for macOS machines
* Please contact the Atlassian support to apply the workaround
fields.summary: Scope's issue view details gets cropped when the description has multiple lines of if the screen has a lower resolution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1404].
  {panel}

*Configuration*:
The story points field is configured for one or a list of specific projects and at the same time applicable for all available issue types.

*Result*:
The story points values set in Portfolio cannot be synced back to JIRA (e.g. via Apply updates to project/s).

*Workaround*:
Make the story points available globally (any projects) or limit it to specific issue types (not all).
fields.summary: Story points field cannot be updated to JIRA when the field is not globally available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Today I ran a plan update in JIRA Portfolio.

In a JIRA task, Portfolio, incorrectly update the original estimate and planned estimate with an incorrect figure.

Under data, sync, plan update, update estimates is set to off.

Why is this occurring?
fields.summary: Updating JIRA Portfolio Plan, incorrectly update original and remaining estimate in a task

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Portfolio is using legacy nonPublishingEditor role to grant permissions over the app
 At the database table AO_A415DF_AOPERMISSION, Portfolio still use the legacy "editor-nonpub" target_ids for permission-checks, which is wrong.
 This cause to users that are not set at the Portfolio Global permissions to still be able to access it and see/create/manage plans and teams but not able to enter Portfolio Global Settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Did not able to reproduce this on a test instance. Noticed issues happening across some instances

h3. Expected Results

Portfolio should respect the permissions set on Global Permissions or at the Plan permissions
h3. Actual Results

Portfolio is additionally using the legacy "editor-nonpub" target_ids for permission-checks, which is wrong.
h3. Workaround

Contact the Atlassian Support to apply the workaround
fields.summary: Portfolio is using legacy nonPublishingEditor role to grant permissions over the app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A Portfolio plan which has in its issue source (board or filter) the function "portfolioChildIssuesOf" does not schedule the issues

h3. Environment

Portfolio for Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Scrum classic project
# Add 2 new issue types above Epic, "Initiative" and "Phase", for example
# Associate these 2 new issue types to the project's issue type scheme
# On Portfolio settings set the following hierarchy configuration:
#* Initiative
#* Phase
#* Epic
#* Story
#* Sub-Task
# On the Scrum project, create a new Initiative (let's call it SCRUM-1)
# On the Portfolio view, add a Phase (let's call it SCRUM-2) child of the Initiative SCRUM-1
# Add Epics and stories under the Phase SCRUM-2 and add estimates to them. Also, add them to a version created in this project
# Create a filter using the JQL below
#* {{issuekey in portfolioChildIssuesOf("SCRUM-1") or issuekey = SCRUM-1}}
# Create a new classic Scrum board based on the filter above
# Create a Portfolio plan using the board created in the previous step as the issue source
# Click the "Calculate" button on the plan

h3. Expected Results

The Portfolio schedule the issues according to its settings

h3. Actual Results

The Portfolio does not schedule any issues on the plan

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Change the filter in order to return the desired issues without using the function "portfolioChildIssuesOf"
fields.summary: A Portfolio plan which has in its issue source (board or filter) the function "portfolioChildIssuesOf" does not schedule the issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Inconsistent capacity view behaviour with certain Grouping option select in capacity setting.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set the plan's view filter to certain release and team.
# By default, grouping is set to none and the capacity view could be showing the team has 100% free capacity.
# Change the grouping to *Team* and the capacity view starts showing the real capacity planned for the team.

On a different team, the *None* grouping could be showing that the team has been overbooked - red capacity. Changing it to *Team* remove the overbooked capacity.

h3. Expected result
The capacity view should be consistent to avoid misinformation.

h3. Current result
The view is inconsistent and it is difficult to tell which view that is showing the right number especially for the overbooked capacity.
fields.summary: Inconsistent capacity view behaviour with certain Grouping in capacity setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Wrong project selected if there is a required field during new issue creation (Committing changes)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a plan and import at least 2 projects
# Have an Epic with 2 Stories from 2 different projects (project A and B)
# Make _Description_ field required in project A
# Create a new Subtask under Story from project A, but select project B as the project type
#* !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Commit the changes

h3. Actual Result

* Pop up screen appears prompting users to key in value for Description (/)
* The project field isn't editable and the default project selection is project A (instead of project B) (x)
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* If the user proceed with it, the Subtask will be created under project A even users selected project B as the project type.

h3. Expected Result

* The correct project type should be shown and selected.
* And the correct error message is shown
** {noformat} Issue 'SPT SubTask' cannot be created as a sub-task of an issue in a different project.{noformat}
fields.summary: Wrong project selected if there is a required field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the Teams page, if there are over 50 teams in Portfolio, only the first 50 will be displayed on the page.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Portfolio;
 # Access the Managed Teams page  --https://{instanceURL}/secure/TeamManagement.jspa#teams
# Create 51 groups;
# Only the first 50 will be displayed.

h3. Expected Results

Keep scrolling down displaying all the teams or display pages to navigate through them.

h3. Actual Results

Only the first 50 teams are displayed.

h3. Notes

Reproducing the behavior:  [^Screen Recording 2019-06-20 at 04.32 PM.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Use the search box to find the desired teams.
fields.summary: Shared Teams page does not display over 50 teams.

fields.description:
h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *Portfolio* > *Create Plan*
# Choose some Project as an Issue Source
# In the Teams section change the *Team scheduling methodology* from Kanban to Scrum

h3. Expected Results
The *Team scheduling methodology* is changed from Kanban to Scrum and no error is yield

h3. Actual Results
The *Team scheduling methodology* is changed from Kanban to Scrum but there is the following error:
*  !Bummer.png|thumbnail!

Close the error and proceed with creating the plan.

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* Portfolio for Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to reproduce:
* Add a project to a plan that has versions
* Make sure you have estimated issues of the same project in your plan
* Manually assign some of these issues to versions of this project
* Recalculate your plan
* Exclude that project as an issue source from your plan
* Reload your plan

h3. Expected behaviour
* The plan loads correctly

h3. Actual behaviour
* A bummer message pops up and the browser console shows the error {{this.attributes.project is undefined}}

h3. Workaround
* Recalculate your plan after the project was excluded
fields.summary: Bummer and script error "this.attributes.project is undefined" when opening Portfolio plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1696].
  {panel}

You are not able to commit time estimates from Portfolio if time tracking is disabled on your JIRA instance.
While this is fairly expected (I would say), there should at least be an error/warning message describing this to the user.

Symptoms:
- Committing time based estimates will still result in no estimates being applied to the JIRA item, and will not be applied in Portfolio

Workaround:
- Enable time tracking as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-time-tracking-802593086.html]
fields.summary: Committing time estimates from Portfolio does not work properly with time tracking disabled
Kanban teams are not fully scheduled if the stage/sprint constraint is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1207].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create 2 groups - _read-only_ and _portfolio-editor_.
# Grant _read-only_ group with *Portfolio Viewer* permission in Portfolio global permission.
# Grant _portfolio-editor_ group with *Portfolio User* permission in Portfolio global permission.
# Create 2 users - _User A_ and _User B_.
# Put _User A_ in _read-only_ and _User B_ in _portfolio-editor_.
# Create a Portfolio plan.
# Configure the plan's permission to give only _User B_ for *Viewers*.
# Login with _User A_ and try to access the plan. It is allowing this user to view it regardless of the plan's permission.
# Add _portfolio-editor_ group to plan's permission *Editors*.
# Now, _User A_ will be blocked from accessing the plan.

Expected Behavior:
Portfolio should only allow _User B_ to access the plan without the need of setting a group for *Editors* to enforce the permission.
fields.summary: Plan's permission getting bypassed by global permission

fields.description:
Team members scheduled in Portfolio do not respect the Jira issue assignee when the "Issue assignee import level" is set.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Set the "Issue assignee import level" to the preferred level (e.g. Story)
 # Assignee somebody in Jira to an issue (e.g. Person A is assigned to Issue A)
 # Do not manually assign a member on Issue A in Portfolio
 # Calculate the schedule

Expected behaviour:
 * The issue assignee from Jira is respected

Actual behaviour:
 * The issue assignee from Jira is ignored

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue assignee import level is not respected

# Create a Portfolio plan using any issue source having at least one epic and a story linked to this epic
# On the Portfolio view, add a dependency between the story and its parent Epic


h3. Expected Results

A warning message appears telling the user there is a loop dependency problem

h3. Actual Results

The message *Unexpected scheduling error* is displayed, not describing what is causing this. The dependency report does not work

https://cl.ly/a07ef8c54baf

h3. Logs

When exporting a CSV of a search of issues that have a team filled in, the "team" field in the CSV gives the team id number (same as reported by the "Jira team" field) instead of the name of the team.

h3. Environment
Cloud

# add the team field to a screen so that you can add it to some issues.
# search those issues

The name of the team is given under the "team" field.

The Team id number is returned instead.

N/a

Exporting to word document returns the expected value.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portofolio administrators are missing links for Portfolio Settings

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assign a group to the *Portfolio Administrator* permissions.
# Grant the group to a non-siteadmin and non-jira administrator user.
# Access the Portfolio Settings as that user.

h3. Expected Results

The portfolio settings should be available to the user.

!expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Only the permission setting is available for the user. 

 !results.png|thumbnail! 
The Portfolio License, Hierarchy levels and Dependencies Settings are missing. 



h3. Workaround

Add an app switcher link for the portfolio administrators to access the portfolio settings. 

 !app switch.png|thumbnail! 

||LINK||URL||GROUP||	
|Portfolio Dependencies|https://<cloud_site>/secure/PortfolioDependencySettings.jspa|<Portfolio Administrator Group>|
|Portfolio Hierarchy Configurations|https://<cloud_site>/secure/PortfolioHierarchy.jspa|<Portfolio Administrator Group>|
|Portfolio License|https://<cloud_site>/secure/PortfolioLicense.jspa|<Portfolio Administrator Group>|
|Portfolio Permissions|https://<cloud_site>/secure/PortfolioPermissions.jspa|<Portfolio Administrator Group>|

 !app switch link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Missing setting links for Portfolio Administrators

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the language to Japanese -  !japanese language selection option.png|thumbnail! 
# Add due date if it is not already configured to the project
# Go to portfolio and edit an issue
# In an issue, set the Target due date("目標締切日") 
 !スクリーンショット 2019-01-15 18.01.59.png|thumbnail!

This same error has been reproduced in several other languages so appears to apply to any non english language selection.

The due date change is returned

The following error saying the date is invalid is shown

Change the language to English

fields.description:
*Summary*

Users are not able to set granular settings manually in Stages and Skills of Original Estimates column after disabled the percentage settings.

The same issue doesn’t happen on Stages and Skill in “Estimate” column.

 

*Steps to Replicate*
 # Click “Configure” in “…” button next to plan’s title.
 # Create at least 2 Stages and Skills
 # Set the percentage settings in Stage and Skills to 0%
 # Go to Plan page, expand Stages and Skills columns in “Original Estimate” column.
 # Insert an estimate manually in one of the Stages and Skills columns.

 

*Expected Result*

The estimate in Stages and Skills columns should not change after customer set it manually.

Original Estimate column should display the sum of the estimates of Stages and Skills columns.

 

*Current Result*

The estimate in Stages and Skills will change and replaced by the distributed value of Original Estimate column.
fields.summary: Not able to set estimates manually in Stages and Skills of Original Estimates column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Portfolio for Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Scope View of a Plan
# Open the Detail View of an Epic or Story
# Expand the roadmap (pull the line under the Roadmap down) until Detail View does not fit the page completely anymore
# Now you get a scrolling bar in the Detail View but if you scroll all the way down, there is still content cut, that is not viewable (see Screenshot)

 !Scroll_to_the_bottom.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
All the content of the Epic or Story is visible. The user can scroll all the way to the bottom

h3. Actual Results
The scroll does not reach the bottom

h3. Workaround

Compact the plan view until all the details of the Epic are seen, without a scroll bar
fields.summary: scrolling on an Epic view does not reach the bottom
